question: True or false: the longer you go without a win, the more likely you are to win on the next bet.
answers: True
False
answerExplain: Winning or losing bets in the past has no impact on the probability of winning in the future.

question: Which groups of sports bettors are at higher risk of gambling problems?
answers: Men are at higher risk than women
Middle-aged adults are at higher risk than young adults
Single adults are at higher risk than adults in a relationship
Caucasians are at higher risk than Asians
answerExplain: Younger bettors are at higher risk of gambling problems due to lack of experience and knowledge of responsible gambling beliefs and practices. Other risk factors include being male, single, and Asian.

question: Which of the following is a healthy gambling belief?
answers: You can earn money through betting if you are skilled enough
You’ll eventually win back money you lost if you keep betting
A near miss means that you were close to winning
None of the above are healthy beliefs
answerExplain: Sports betting odds are set in a way that sportsbooks make money from bettors no matter who wins. This, combined with the element of chance, makes it hard to win back lost money no matter how skilled or knowledgeable a bettor is. Near misses may be due to chance and do not necessarily mean that you were on the right track.

question: Which of the following are unhealthy reasons for betting on sports?
answers: To have fun
To relieve negative feelings
To compete with others
To pay bills
answerExplain: Only gamble to have fun or entertain yourself. Gambling to pay bills, earn money, challenge other people, or relieve negative feelings are all unhealthy reasons for betting that are correlated with gambling problems.

question: If you want to safely take advantage of a betting promotion, which of the following should you do?
answers: Read the fine print carefully
Stop betting when the promotion no longer applies
Take advantage of the offer by betting more money
Exceed your budget because the offer is low-risk
answerExplain: Betting offers may have unexpected conditions, so be sure to read the fine print carefully. Promotions often appear to reduce the risk of losing while enhancing the reward for winning but are designed to encourage you to bet more and spend more. If you didn’t plan to, don’t continue betting once the offer no longer applies.

question: Why is it hard to earn money from sports betting?
answers: Most people are not knowledgeable enough to win
A significant number of sporting events are rigged
The sportsbook takes a cut of every bet
People are too confident when they are winning
answerExplain: Earning more money than you lose is hard because sportsbook takes a cut of every bet, which is called the “juice” or “vig.” For example, if the odds are -110 on both sides, two bettors pay $110 in opposing bets, but the sportsbook takes $10 and the winner is only paid $210 rather than $220.

question: Evidence shows the betting advertising has the following effects…
answers: Reinforces social stigma of sports betting
Encourages people to spend more money betting
Encourages people to bet more often
Causes recovering gamblers to relapse
answerExplain: Studies show that betting advertisements encourage people to bet, partly by reducing stigma and cultivating positive perceptions of sports betting. People who have (had) gambling problems are the most susceptible to advertising.

question: Which of the following are responsible betting strategies?
answers: Stop betting if you’re not having fun
Bet while under the influence of substances
Bet more money when you’ve been winning
Set a limit on how often you bet and how much time you play for

question: Which of the following are responsible betting strategies?
answers: Don’t bet when you’re upset
Set a budget and stick to it
Take frequent breaks
Bet on the spur of the moment when the odds are good
answerExplain: Placing bets when you’re upset, in the heat of the moment, or immersed in the activity for prolonged periods can cause you to make impulsive decisions with your money. Be sure to take frequent breaks and stick to your budget.

answers: Cash out losing bets early and bet on something else
Only stop betting when you’ve broken even
Stop betting once you’ve spent the amount you planned to spend
Use your winnings to place more bets
answerExplain: The best way to avoid losing more money than you can afford to lose is to stop betting once you’ve spent the amount of money you budgeted for betting, even if you’ve lost that money. Options to “cash-out” losing bets and reuse winnings to place more bets are correlated with gambling problems because they encourage bettors to continue betting. Recouping lost money by placing more bets is difficult because odds are designed so that the sportsbook makes money from bettors.

question: True or false: if you always bet on the heavy favourite, you’ll gain money over the long term.
answers: True
False
answerExplain: There is always a chance that the heavy favourite could lose. Sportsbooks set odds for favourites so that you must risk a lot of money for a small reward. The money you forfeit by losing a few times will exceed what you gain by winning many times.

question: All legal Ontario sportsbooks are required to provide the following…
answers: Spending or loss limiting controls
Self-exclusion, a self-imposed platform ban
Information about your betting activity
Free counselling services
answerExplain: All Ontario sportsbooks are required to provide bettors with money limiting controls, betting account information, and the option to self-exclude. By self-excluding, bettors can ban themselves from a betting platform and opt out of betting-related marketing. In the future, Ontario iGaming is planning to implement a province-wide self-exclusion program that applies to all sportsbooks.
